intro: Monteverdia grenadensis, commonly known as the Grenada monteverdia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Grenada in the Caribbean. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
